TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F. Austin to Samuel M. Williams, 11-18-1824

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 970

div1.p: I wish Mr Williams to sleep in my house while I am gone and take special care of everything particularly the corn and meat and the two motherless pigs—also to set Dolly, Patsy, and Henry to piling the pumpkins and covering them with corn stacks—keep the crib and smoke House locked—make out a number of blank deeds for individual transfers—and take care office
